Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Monogamous \Mo*nog"a*mous\, a. [L. monogamus having but one wife, Gr. ?; mo`nos single + ? marriage.] 1. Upholding, or practicing, monogamy. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) Same as {Monogamian}. [1913 Webster]
3. (Zo["o]l.) Mating with but one of the opposite sex; -- said of birds and mammals. [1913 Webster]
